result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J. Boehm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Workforce Develop. Employee [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.207(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided. 
Completion of AODA and follow through with all recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Cooperate with Langlade County Department of Health and Social Services. 
Participate in counseling and assessments as deemed beneficial by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM/Room 203. Defendant Derek J. Boehm in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Derek J. Boehm.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court by Zoom for State of Wisconsin. 22CF37, 22CF16, 20CF19, 19CM138, 19CM141, 19CF210. Court recites status of cases. Attny Restemayer provided additional information to State today; State requested adjournment to research additional info. Def. wants to proceed today. Attny Restemayer cannot proceed; Def. given options. Def. wants to proceed without an attorney. Remarks by State, asks that Def. waive issue that counsel was communicating with State. Def. waives issue. Attny Restemayer indicates he has discussed issues with Def. as well as him proceeding without an attorney. Waiver of attorney reviewed. Clarification given to deferred entry of judgment on both 20CF19 and 19CF210. Potential penalties and attorney rights reviewed on all cases. No coercion.  Def. understands and wants to proceed without counsel. The Court finds that Def. has voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived right to counsel on all cases. Def. again confirms he wants to proceed without attorney. Court will allow Def. to represent self. Attny Restemayer excused from hearing. Off the record. On the record. State now appears in person.
22CF16 and 22CF37 - Def. wants to waive right to a preliminary hearing. Waiver of P.H. reviewed. Court notes that Attny Restemayer has rejoined courtroom and is sitting in gallery to observe. Continuation of waiver of P.H. review. Court finds that Def. has waived right to P.H., finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. State has e-filed Information and provided copies to Def; contain the same charges. Def. has received Information and waives reading.
State recites agreement. Def to plead to 22CF37: Ct. 1 and 2 to be DRI.  Ct. 3 plea. Ct. 4, 5, 6 to be DRI.  22CF16: Ct. 1 plead. Ct. 2 DRI. Ct. 3-4 plea. Ct. 5-6 to be DRI. Statement of uncharged read-ins to be filed. 20-cf19- Ct. 1 DEJ - stipulation to revocation. 19CF210- DEJ Stipulation to revoking agreement. 22CF37 - Ct. 3 - 6 years prison imp stayed (3 ic, 3 es), consecutive to any sentence, 4 years probation.  Costs with Surcharge, sample, AODA and followthru, maintain abs. sobriety, cooperate with Social Services, fulltime employment, counseling and assessments.
Recommendations:
22CF16: Ct. 1 -withheld sentence, 3 years probation, concurrent, costs with surcharge, comply with conditions in 22CF37.  Ct. 3 - 1 year jail, imp/stayed, concurrent, 3 years probation, costs with surcharge, comply with conditions in 22CF37.   Ct. 4 - withheld sentence, 3 years probation, concurrent, costs with surcharge, comply with conditions in 22CF37. SAR on 20CF19  - Ct. 1 - wh, 2 years probation, concurrent, costs with surcharge, same conditions as 22CF37.  Ct. 2 and 5 - 9 months jail, concurrent with each other and concurrent with 19CM138 and 19CM141 Ct. 2. 19CF210- Ct. 1 - withheld sentence, 2 years probation, concurrent, costs with surcharge, comply with 22CF37. Ct. 2 - 30 days jail, concurrent to 20CF19 Ct. 2 and 5 and 19CM138 and 19CM141 and Cts. 2 and 5 in 20CF19.  Ct.5 - 9 months jail, concurrent to Ct. 2, 20 cf19 and 19CM141 and 19CM138. 19CM138  - 90 days jail, concurrent.  19CM141- Ct. 2 - 9 months jail, concurrent
State has complied with victim rights.Def. understands and wants to proceed. Def. has received revocation packet. State has received revocation packet. No other deletions, corrections.
Court declares DEJ on Ct. 1 in both 20CF19 and 19CF210 are revoked; will proceed with sentencing. Plea questionnaire reviewed. 
Def. pleads to 
22CF37 - Ct. 3 - Battery to workforce development, repeater, no contest.   
22CF16 - Ct. 1  -Felony bail jumping, repeater no contest,  Ct. 3 - Poss of meth, repeater, no contest.   Ct. 4 - Neglecting a child, repeater, no contest.
Court grants State's motion to DRI in 22CF37: Ct. 1, 2, 4, 5 and 6; and 22CF16 - Ct. 2, 5, and 6.
Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. The Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas were freely and voluntarily given. Court finds there is a factual basis in 22CF37 and 22CF16, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 3 in 22CF37 and Ct. 1, Ct. 3 and Ct. 4 in 22CF16.
Sentencing remarks by State. Def. makes statement. Remarks by the Court.
The Court will follow agreement, orders

SAR cases/counts:
20CF19:  Same sentence on Ct. 2 and 5 - 9 months jail, on each count, Huber, concurrent with each other and concurrent with all other cases. Any outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. If money still being held, will be put toward court costs.     
19CM138  - Ct. 1 - 90 days jail, Huber, concurrent, with all others. Any outstanding financial obligations converted to civil judgment.
19CM141-  Ct. 2 - 9 months jail, Huber, concurrent with all other sentencings today. Any financial obligations to be converted to civil judgment.
19CF210:- Ct. 2  - 30 days jail, Huber, concurrent to all sentences ordered today. Ct. 5 - 9 months jail, Huber, concurrent to all sentences ordered today.   Any financial obligations to be converted. 

DEJ counts
19CF210- Ct. 1 - withheld sentence, 2 years probation, costs only with surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, same conditions of probation on all new probation. 
20CF19 -  Ct. 1 - withheld sentence, 2 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, same conditions. If bond/attorney fees left over, to be put toward court costs. If balance, to be returned to poster.

New cases:
22CF37 - Ct. 3 - 6 years prison, imposed/stayed (3 init. conf, 3 ext. sup.), consecutive to any other sentence ordered today, 4 years probation, court costs only with DNA surcharge, completion of AODA and follow thru with all recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, cooperate with Langlade County Department of Health and Social Services, maintain fulltime employment 30hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate in counseling and assessments as deemed beneficial by agent.
22CF16: Ct. 1 -withheld sentence, 3 years probation, costs only with DNA surcharge, same conditions of probation.  Ct. 3 - 1 year jail, imp/stayed, Huber, consecutive to any other sentence ordered today, 3 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, same conditions of probation.   Ct. 4 - withheld sentence, 3 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, comply same conditions of probation. 
All jail sentences to include Huber.
Credit:  
19CM138 - 196 days.  19CM141 - 194 days.  19CF210 - 204 days. 20CF19 - 247 days. 22CF16, zero days. 22CF37 - zero days. 
22CF37 - Not eligible for either challenge incarceration or substance abuse.  Voting/firearm rights. Post conviction rights. If there are any cash bonds, to be applied to costs with refund to be returned to poster.

02:00 PM Defendant Derek J. Boehm in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Derek J. Boehm in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Derek J. Boehm appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Zich appears special for Atty Restemayer and request a timely p.h. State has complied with victim rights. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:28 PM Defendant Derek J. Boehm in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek J. Boehm appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  This case was set for yesterday and we didn't get to the case until today.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:35 PM Defendant Derek J. Boehm in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. is on probation hold.  Def. makes statment on bond. Court orders $7000 cash bond with conditions  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
